body:
It's also behaving the same in Gujarati (language) font. 
![Font rendering error in gujrati](https://i.ibb.co/9Zf0Svg/Screenshot-2019-11-04-at-10-38-32-PM.png)
It looks like the canonical way of iterating through graphemes (characters, including diacritics) is to use the BreakIterator https://developer.android.com/reference/java/text/BreakIterator

@Adimote-work @kartik1225 I would accept a PR for this. You may want to check out the [code point parsing](https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/blob/5e12628a0ded9eb37473a3b7b54d0cccf8ef86be/lottie/src/main/java/com/airbnb/lottie/model/layer/TextLayer.java#L373) as well. I can't read Hindi or Gujarati myself so this one will be difficult for me to do well.

We too are facing the same issue in android. @gpeal you need not actually understand the language, all you need to see that there are no dotted circles getting displayed. 

Here is similar issue mentioned with web player -> https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-web/issues/1603 

And the patch code for resolving the issue in web -> https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-web/commit/978935d35f6ee40a015cbf451ba11f55df3dab4d

issue.title: Font rendering issue for hindi (non-latin) characters

repository.name: lottie-android
repository.description: Render After Effects animations natively on Android and iOS, Web, and React Native

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
We're trying to render hindi characters that are inserted at runtime with TextDelegate support:
`setText("///trail.feast.beam", "///बादल.मीठा.अमूल्य")`
As you can see in the attached screenshot and project, some characters are not rendered correctly. Android seems to have a default fallback to always render unicode characters but in lottie's case this doesn't happen.
What do you think about this issue, how exactly should we approach this ?

**What version of Lottie did you test this on?**
Latest lottie android 3.6.1

**What version of Android did you test this on?**
Android 10, Pixel 2 XL

**Steps To Reproduce**
Attached a project where you can see the issue:
[MyApplication.zip](https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/files/6235991/MyApplication.zip)

**Screenshots**
![Screenshot_20210331-134645](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/189993/113133625-8d2fcf80-9228-11eb-8f91-5a1470865254.png)

body:
Hi guys,
Sorry to bother you with this. Does anybody know if this issue will get solved sometimes in the next 1-2 months ?
I would happily accept a PR for this

issue.title: Improve support for Hindi and other languages that use DIRECTIONALITY_NONSPACING_MARK

repository.name: lottie-android
repository.description: Render After Effects animations natively on Android and iOS, Web, and React Native

body: Do you know when we should expect a release version for this issue ?
@mmdumi Today! I published 5.0 this morning. Blog post coming soon.

issue.body: Sample text i am trying is **اسم** this but its rendered as below image, anyone has faced this issue. what could be the solution to support this. i am using the latest dist from Very similar issue at lottie-android here https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/issues/2279 and relevant fix https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/pull/2001/files And was there in lottie web (https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-web/issues/1603) and the provided patch here(https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/issues/1396) worked for lottie web. but not sure how to make it work for lottie-player
